Package suga.engine.physics.hitboxes

Interface HitBox

All Known Implementing Classes:
SquareHitBox
public interface HitBox
Every collidable object needs a HitBox which defines when collisions occur.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    drawHitBox(GraphicsPanelInterface panel)
    Draws this hit box to the given graphics panel.
    Vector
    getPos()
    Gets the center position of this hit box.
    Collection<Vector>
    getTestPoints()
    Returns a collection of test points for this hit box.
    boolean
    isInside(Vector test)
    Tests whether the given point is within this hit box or not.
    void
    setPos(Vector pos)
    Sets the center position of this hit box.
    boolean
    touching(Vector test)
    Tests whether the given point is touching this hit box or not.

  • Method Details

    • getPos

      Vector getPos()
      Gets the center position of this hit box.
      Returns:
      The center position of the hit box.

    • setPos

      void setPos(Vector pos)
      Sets the center position of this hit box. Used to center hit boxes on game objects.
      Parameters:
      pos - The new center position of this hit box.

    • getTestPoints

      Collection<Vector> getTestPoints()
      Returns a collection of test points for this hit box.
      Returns:
      A collection of test points to be used in collision detection.

    • isInside

      boolean isInside(Vector test)
      Tests whether the given point is within this hit box or not.
      Parameters:
      test - The point to test. Represented in vector form.
      Returns:
      True if and only if the test point is inside this hit box.

    • touching

      boolean touching(Vector test)
      Tests whether the given point is touching this hit box or not.
      Parameters:
      test - The point to test. Represented in vector form.
      Returns:
      True if and only if the test point is on the boundary of this hit box.

    • drawHitBox

      void drawHitBox(GraphicsPanelInterface panel)
      Draws this hit box to the given graphics panel. Different hit boxes may appear differently when drawn.
      Parameters:
      panel - The panel to draw the hit box test points to.
